description: PortSwigger Web Security Academy - FREE comprehensive web security training with interactive labs covering OWASP Top 10 and advanced topics.

bash.academy_guide:
#!/bin/bash
# PortSwigger Academy Quick Start - FREE!

echo "🎓 PortSwigger Web Security Academy (COMPLETELY FREE!)"
echo "====================================================="
echo ""

echo "🧪 200+ FREE Interactive Labs:"
echo "   • SQL Injection"
echo "   • Cross-site Scripting"
echo "   • Authentication"
echo "   • SSRF"
echo "   • XXE"
echo "   • Access Control"
echo "   • And much more!"
echo ""

echo "📚 Learning Paths:"
echo "   1. Server-side vulnerabilities"
echo "   2. Client-side vulnerabilities"
echo "   3. Advanced topics"
echo ""

echo "🎯 How to Start:"
echo "   1. Visit: https://portswigger.net/web-security"
echo "   2. Choose a topic"
echo "   3. Read the theory"
echo "   4. Start a lab (no signup needed!)"
echo "   5. Practice exploitation"
echo "   6. Check solutions if stuck"
echo ""

echo "🔧 Tools:"
echo "   • Burp Suite Community (FREE)"
echo "   • Built-in lab browser"
echo "   • Video solutions"
echo "   • Community help"
echo ""

echo "🏆 Benefits:"
echo "   • Industry-recognized training"
echo "   • Real vulnerability practice"
echo "   • Certificate of completion"
echo "   • Exam preparation"
echo ""

echo "🆓 100% FREE - No credit card required!"

curl.check_academy:
# Check PortSwigger Academy - FREE!
curl -s https://portswigger.net/web-security | grep -i 'free' | head -5

python.academy_helper:
import requests
import json
from typing import Dict, List

class PortSwiggerAcademyHelper:
    """PortSwigger Web Security Academy Helper - FREE Training!"""
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.base_url = 'https://portswigger.net/web-security'
        
    def learning_paths(self):
        """Get structured learning paths (FREE!)"""
        print("🎓 PortSwigger Academy Learning Paths (COMPLETELY FREE!)\n")
        
        paths = {
            'Server-side topics': [
                'SQL injection',
                'Authentication',
                'Directory traversal',
                'Command injection',
                'Business logic vulnerabilities',
                'Information disclosure',
                'Access control',
                'File upload vulnerabilities',
                'SSRF',
                'XXE injection'
            ],
            'Client-side topics': [
                'Cross-site scripting (XSS)',
                'CSRF',
                'CORS',
                'Clickjacking',
                'DOM-based vulnerabilities',
                'WebSockets'
            ],
            'Advanced topics': [
                'Insecure deserialization',
                'Web cache poisoning',
                'HTTP Host header attacks',
                'HTTP request smuggling',
                'OAuth authentication',
                'JWT attacks',
                'GraphQL API vulnerabilities',
                'Race conditions',
                'Server-side template injection',
                'Web cache deception',
                'Browser-powered desync'
            ]
        }
        
        for path_name, topics in paths.items():
            print(f"📚 {path_name}:")
            for topic in topics:
                print(f"   • {topic}")
            print()
        
        return paths
    
    def lab_catalog(self):
        """Catalog of all free labs (FREE!)"""
        print("🧪 PortSwigger Academy Lab Catalog (200+ FREE LABS!)\n")
        
        labs = {
            'SQL Injection': {
                'count': 30,
                'difficulties': ['Apprentice', 'Practitioner', 'Expert'],
                'examples': [
                    'SQL injection vulnerability in WHERE clause',
                    'SQL injection UNION attacks',
                    'Blind SQL injection with conditional responses',
                    'SQL injection with filter bypass',
                    'Second-order SQL injection'
                ]
            },
            'Cross-site Scripting': {
                'count': 30,
                'difficulties': ['Apprentice', 'Practitioner', 'Expert'],
                'examples': [
                    'Reflected XSS into HTML context',
                    'Stored XSS into HTML context',
                    'DOM XSS in jQuery anchor',
                    'XSS with Angular sandbox escape',
                    'XSS in JSON data via CSP bypass'
                ]
            },
            'CSRF': {
                'count': 12,
                'difficulties': ['Apprentice', 'Practitioner'],
                'examples': [
                    'CSRF vulnerability with no defenses',
                    'CSRF with broken token validation',
                    'CSRF with token tied to non-session cookie',
                    'CSRF with SameSite cookie bypass'
                ]
            },
            'Authentication': {
                'count': 14,
                'difficulties': ['Apprentice', 'Practitioner', 'Expert'],
                'examples': [
                    'Username enumeration',
                    'Password reset broken logic',
                    '2FA simple bypass',
                    'Password brute-force via password change',
                    'Broken brute-force protection'
                ]
            },
            'Server-side Request Forgery': {
                'count': 7,
                'difficulties': ['Apprentice', 'Practitioner', 'Expert'],
                'examples': [
                    'Basic SSRF against local server',
                    'SSRF with blacklist bypass',
                    'SSRF with whitelist bypass',
                    'Blind SSRF with out-of-band detection'
                ]
            }
        }
        
        total_labs = 0
        for category, details in labs.items():
            print(f"🔬 {category}:")
            print(f"   Total labs: {details['count']}")
            print(f"   Difficulties: {', '.join(details['difficulties'])}")
            print("   Example labs:")
            for lab in details['examples'][:3]:
                print(f"      • {lab}")
            print()
            total_labs += details['count']
        
        print(f"📊 Total FREE labs: {total_labs}+\n")
        return labs
    
    def burp_suite_integration(self):
        """Burp Suite integration guide (FREE!)"""
        print("🔧 Burp Suite Integration (FREE!)\n")
        
        print("🆓 Burp Suite Community Edition:\n")
        features = [
            "FREE version available",
            "Perfect for Academy labs",
            "Proxy for intercepting requests",
            "Repeater for modifying requests",
            "Decoder for encoding/decoding",
            "Comparer for response analysis",
            "Sequencer for randomness testing",
            "Built-in browser"
        ]
        
        for feature in features:
            print(f"   • {feature}")
        
        print("\n🎯 Using Burp with Academy Labs:\n")
        steps = [
            "Download Burp Suite Community (FREE)",
            "Start Burp and open browser",
            "Navigate to Academy lab",
            "Intercept and modify requests",
            "Follow lab instructions",
            "Use hints if stuck",
            "Check community solutions",
            "Learn from video walkthroughs"
        ]
        
        for i, step in enumerate(steps, 1):
            print(f"   {i}. {step}")
        
        print("\n💡 Pro Tips:\n")
        tips = [
            "Use Burp's embedded browser",
            "Enable request/response logging",
            "Use Repeater for testing",
            "Check Proxy history",
            "Use Intruder for automation",
            "Learn keyboard shortcuts",
            "Save project files",
            "Use extensions from BApp Store"
        ]
        
        for tip in tips:
            print(f"   • {tip}")
        
        return features
    
    def certification_path(self):
        """Path to Burp Suite certification (FREE training!)"""
        print("🏆 Burp Suite Certification Path (FREE TRAINING!)\n")
        
        print("📚 Exam Topics (All FREE to learn):\n")
        topics = {
            'Web Security Fundamentals': [
                'HTTP basics',
                'Cookies and sessions',
                'Same-origin policy',
                'Content Security Policy'
            ],
            'Common Vulnerabilities': [
                'SQL injection',
                'Cross-site scripting',
                'CSRF',
                'XXE',
                'SSRF',
                'Path traversal'
            ],
            'Authentication & Access': [
                'Authentication mechanisms',
                'Session management',
                'Access control',
                'OAuth',
                'JWT'
            ],
            'Advanced Topics': [
                'Deserialization',
                'Request smuggling',
                'Cache poisoning',
                'WebSockets',
                'GraphQL'
            ]
        }
        
        for category, items in topics.items():
            print(f"   📖 {category}:")
            for item in items:
                print(f"      • {item}")
            print()
        
        print("🎯 Preparation Strategy:\n")
        strategy = [
            "Complete all Academy learning paths",
            "Practice with 200+ free labs",
            "Watch video solutions",
            "Join study groups",
            "Take practice exams",
            "Review community notes",
            "Master Burp Suite tools",
            "Understand vulnerability chains"
        ]
        
        for step in strategy:
            print(f"   • {step}")
        
        print("\n💰 Cost Breakdown:\n")
        print("   • Academy Training: FREE")
        print("   • Practice Labs: FREE")
        print("   • Study Materials: FREE")
        print("   • Burp Community: FREE")
        print("   • Exam Fee: $99 (only cost)\n")
        
        return topics
    
    def learning_resources(self):
        """Additional learning resources (FREE!)"""
        print("📚 Additional Learning Resources (ALL FREE!)\n")
        
        print("🎥 Video Content:\n")
        videos = [
            "Lab walkthroughs",
            "Concept explanations",
            "Tool demonstrations",
            "Exam tips",
            "Community solutions",
            "Expert interviews",
            "Conference talks",
            "Research presentations"
        ]
        
        for video in videos:
            print(f"   • {video}")
        
        print("\n📝 Written Resources:\n")
        written = [
            "Detailed vulnerability explanations",
            "Step-by-step tutorials",
            "Cheat sheets",
            "Methodology guides",
            "Best practices",
            "Research papers",
            "Blog posts",
            "Community notes"
        ]
        
        for resource in written:
            print(f"   • {resource}")
        
        print("\n🌟 Community Features:\n")
        community = [
            "Solution sharing",
            "Discussion forums",
            "Study groups",
            "Discord servers",
            "Reddit communities",
            "Twitter updates",
            "YouTube channels",
            "Practice challenges"
        ]
        
        for feature in community:
            print(f"   • {feature}")
        
        print("\n🔗 Start Learning:\n")
        print(f"   URL: {self.base_url}")
        print("   Registration: Optional (FREE)")
        print("   All content: 100% FREE\n")
        
        return videos
    
    def why_portswigger_academy(self):
        """Why choose PortSwigger Academy (FREE!)"""
        print("🌟 Why PortSwigger Web Security Academy? (FREE!)\n")
        
        print("✅ Key Benefits:\n")
        benefits = [
            "200+ FREE interactive labs",
            "Created by Burp Suite makers",
            "Industry-recognized training",
            "Covers all major vulnerabilities",
            "Real-world scenarios",
            "Step-by-step solutions",
            "Video walkthroughs",
            "Progress tracking",
            "Certificates of completion",
            "No time limits"
        ]
        
        for benefit in benefits:
            print(f"   • {benefit}")
        
        print("\n🎯 Perfect For:\n")
        audiences = [
            "Security professionals",
            "Penetration testers",
            "Bug bounty hunters",
            "Software developers",
            "DevSecOps engineers",
            "Security students",
            "Career changers",
            "Certification candidates"
        ]
        
        for audience in audiences:
            print(f"   • {audience}")
        
        print("\n🏅 Recognition:\n")
        print("   • Industry standard training")
        print("   • Used by top companies")
        print("   • Recommended by experts")
        print("   • Certification available")
        print("   • Global community\n")
        
        return benefits

# Usage
helper = PortSwiggerAcademyHelper()
helper.learning_paths()
helper.lab_catalog()
helper.burp_suite_integration()
helper.certification_path()
helper.learning_resources()
